summary: This document contains a Power of Attorney form executed by Jeffrey Epstein, appointing Darren Indyke as his agent for managing accounts with Deutsche Bank Securities Inc. It outlines the responsibilities and limitations of the agent's authority, as well as the legal implications of the Power of Attorney. The document also includes internal communications regarding the onboarding of Epstein as a client and the necessary exceptions for his accounts.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein executed a Power of Attorney appointing Darren Indyke as his agent.
The document outlines the responsibilities and limitations of the agent's authority.
Jean Anne Brennan was also appointed as an agent and notarized signatures.
Internal communications indicate that Epstein transferred over $120 million into his accounts.
The document discusses the need for exceptions regarding the Power of Attorney for Epstein's accounts.
